page.title: 04The vicar
page.content: Continued Rev Bell was very pleased with the welcome he had been given in the villages. Everyone had been very friendly to him and his wife. He had many jobs to do throughout the day. These included looking after the two churches in Middleton and East Winch, taking services in both churches, visiting people in the villages, going to the local Primary school where he is also a school governor and teaching people about the life of Jesus. Each week there are two services at Middleton and one at East Winch. The chuirch at East Winch is very interesting because behind the organ there is a bible and a prayer book which date back to 1745.
